intro: Linaria triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers with a distinctive two-lipped structure, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Linaria triquetra thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
